Thor is the Norse god of thunder, lightning, storms, and strength.
Thor wields Mjolnir, a hammer so powerful it can level mountains.
Thursday is named after Thor, derived from Thor\'s Day.
Thor rides a chariot pulled by two goats named Tanngrisnir and Tanngnjóstr.
Thor is the son of Odin, the All-Father, and Jord, the personification of Earth.
Mjolnir always returns to Thor\'s hand after being thrown.
Thor\'s wife is Sif, known for her golden hair that shines like wheat fields.
Thor is said to have immense strength, even among the gods.
Thor\'s hammer Mjolnir was forged by the dwarven brothers Brokkr and Eitri.
Thor protects both gods and humans from the giants.
Thor owns a belt called Megingjord that doubles his already incredible strength.
Thor is one of the most popular and widely worshipped gods in Norse mythology.
Thor\'s hall in Asgard is called Bilskirnir, which has 540 rooms.
Thor once disguised himself as the goddess Freyja to retrieve Mjolnir from giants.
Thor\'s red beard is one of his most distinctive features in Norse tales.
Thor is prophesied to die fighting the serpent Jormungandr during Ragnarok.
Thor uses iron gloves called Járngreipr to wield Mjolnir.
Thor is known for his hearty appetite and can consume entire oxen.
Thor once tried to drink the ocean in a challenge from a giant king.
Thor\'s mother Jord is the earth itself, making Thor part divine and part elemental.
Thor has two sons, Modi and Magni, who will survive Ragnarok.
Thor is often depicted as having fierce eyes that glow when angered.
Thor\'s goats can be eaten and then brought back to life the next day.
Thor is the defender of Midgard, the realm of humans.
Thor has a daughter named Thrud, whose name means strength.
Thor is second only to Odin in the Norse pantheon hierarchy.
Thor\'s hammer Mjolnir is so heavy that only he can lift it.
Thor once lifted a cat that was actually the Midgard Serpent in disguise.
Thor travels between worlds using the rainbow bridge Bifrost.
Thor is known for his straightforward, honest nature and quick temper.
Thor\'s symbol, the hammer, was worn by Vikings for protection.
Thor once wrestled an old woman who was actually Old Age personified.
Thor is associated with oak trees, which are sacred to him.
Thor\'s name means thunder in Old Norse.
Thor is known to have a simple, direct approach to problem-solving.
Thor\'s hammer makes the sound of thunder when striking.
Thor once fought and defeated countless giants single-handedly.
Thor is the god most commonly invoked for protection by common folk.
Thor\'s strength is so great he must wear iron gloves to handle Mjolnir.
Thor is destined to kill the Midgard Serpent but die from its venom.
Thor\'s chariot creates thunder when riding across the sky.
Thor is married to Sif in one of Norse mythology\'s most stable marriages.
Thor\'s hall Bilskirnir is the largest building in existence.
Thor once drank so much that he lowered the sea level noticeably.
Thor represents the common warrior rather than the noble or wise leader.
Thor\'s stepson is Ullr, the god of skiing and archery.
Thor is said to have a voracious appetite matching his legendary strength.
Thor\'s adventures often involve outwitting or outfighting giants.
Thor is the protector of the consecration of marriages and sacred oaths.
Thor will take nine steps after slaying the serpent before falling dead.
